did.unittitle: Louis Wilson collection of maps of Africa
did.abstract: Seven maps (two of the maps are the same) reflecting the geopolitical impact of European colonization on the African continent from the seventeenth to early twentieth centuries. These maps are formerly plates in published books that were removed and sold separately.
did.langmaterial: The maps are in English and French.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Seven maps (two of the maps are the same) reflecting the geopolitical impact of European colonization on the African continent from the seventeenth to early twentieth centuries.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These maps are formerly plates in published books that were removed and sold separately. Louis Wilson purchased them after this book-breaking took place. (Book-breaking to sell illustrative plates separately is, sadly, a common practice across time.) There is insufficient information for the curator to determine from which books these maps were removed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access and Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection are in the public domain due to their age. Researchers need not seek or secure permission to re-use or reproduce materials in the public domain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These maps were donated to the Mortimer Rare Book Collection by Louis Wilson in 2018.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: These maps were accepted from a larger quantity offered by the donor as examples of how parts of Africa were represented and described in the Anglo-American world over time. They were acquired for teaching context and interpretation in the dissemination of geographical and cultural knowledge.
